prompt: Facts: Incident occurred on the evening of 04.07.2008 near Village Ghonda, Delhi.; An altercation took place between Hari Om @ Pintu (brother of the appellant Chandra Shekhar) and the deceased Jagat Singh.; During the initial altercation, Jagat Singh allegedly slapped Hari Om.; Hari Om called his brother, the appellant Chandra Shekhar, to the spot.; Upon Chandra Shekhar's arrival, a further altercation ensued between him and Jagat Singh.; During this second altercation, Chandra Shekhar allegedly stabbed Jagat Singh in the chest with a knife ('chhuri').; PW-1 (Ravi Dutt Sharma, friend of the deceased) was an eyewitness and lodged the FIR.; PW-2 (Sunil Kumar, another friend) was also present.; The deceased, Jagat Singh, was taken to GTB Hospital where he was declared brought dead.; Postmortem examination (conducted by PW-13, Dr. Arvind Kumar) revealed two injuries: Injury No. 1 (stab wound on the left side of the chest, penetrating the lung and aorta, deemed sufficient to cause death in the ordinary course of nature) and Injury No. 2 (incised wound on the left index finger).; The alleged weapon, a knife, was recovered pursuant to the disclosure statement made by the appellant Chandra Shekhar.; The Trial Court convicted Chandra Shekhar under Section 302 IPC and sentenced him to life imprisonment.
